name: GetFigmaWebhooks
description:
Retrieve a list of webhooks from Figma.

Call this tool to get a list of webhooks available in your Figma context or plan. This can be used to manage and view all the webhooks you have access to, with results provided in a paginated format.

parameters.name: webhook_context
parameters.description: Specify the context for the webhooks. Accepts 'team', 'project', or 'file'.

value_schema.description: Context to create the resource on. Should be "team", "project", or "file".

parameters.name: context_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the context to fetch attached webhooks. Cannot be used with plan_api_id.

value_schema.description: The id of the context that you want to get attached webhooks for. If you're using context_id, you cannot use plan_api_id.

parameters.name: plan_id_for_webhooks
parameters.description: The ID of your plan for retrieving webhooks across all accessible contexts. Cannot be used with context or context_id.

value_schema.description: The id of your plan. Use this to get all webhooks for all contexts you have access to. If you're using plan_api_id, you cannot use context or context_id. When you use plan_api_id, the response is paginated.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination when using plan_api_id. Provide next_page or prev_page from previous response to navigate pages.

value_schema.description: If you're using plan_api_id, this is the cursor to use for pagination. If you're using context or context_id, this parameter is ignored. Provide the next_page or prev_page value from the previous response to get the next or previous page of results.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the figma API.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context to create the resource on. Should be "team", "project", or "file".

value_schema.description: Context to create the resource on. Should be "team", "project", or "file".

parameters.name: context_id
parameters.description: The id of the context that you want to get attached webhooks for. If you're using context_id, you cannot use plan_api_id.

value_schema.description: The id of the context that you want to get attached webhooks for. If you're using context_id, you cannot use plan_api_id.

parameters.name: plan_api_id
parameters.description: The id of your plan. Use this to get all webhooks for all contexts you have access to. If you're using plan_api_id, you cannot use context or context_id. When you use plan_api_id, the response is paginated.

value_schema.description: The id of your plan. Use this to get all webhooks for all contexts you have access to. If you're using plan_api_id, you cannot use context or context_id. When you use plan_api_id, the response is paginated.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: If you're using plan_api_id, this is the cursor to use for pagination. If you're using context or context_id, this parameter is ignored. Provide the next_page or prev_page value from the previous response to get the next or previous page of results.

value_schema.description: If you're using plan_api_id, this is the cursor to use for pagination. If you're using context or context_id, this parameter is ignored. Provide the next_page or prev_page value from the previous response to get the next or previous page of results.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
